subject: Re: Shared data between test methods in a testcase
msgSnippet: Thanks.  Yes, I understand why the methods have to be static.  I m just looking for a way around that requirement, since all of the methods that I want to call
messageBody:
Thanks. Yes, I understand why the methods have to be static. I'm
just looking for a way around that requirement, since all of the
methods that I want to call within oneTimeSetup() and oneTimeTearDown
() are *not* static and are existing castor framework code to build
up and delete data for my test cases. I just want to call this
pretty significant setup and tear down code just once and use it for
all of my test cases verses for every testXXX() method via the
regular setup() and tearDown() methods.

What do you mean by "you can always create a singleton"?

thanks,
chad.

--- In junit@y..., Shane Duan <sduan@b...> wrote:
> The reason that they are static is because they need to be called
by
> 'suite()' method, which is a static. If you need to call other
method
> from oneTimeSetup, my hunch is that either those method should be
static
> as well. If that is not the case, then you can always create a
singleton.
>
